def_cn: 房屋;房子;住宅
def_en: A house is a building in which people live, usually the people belonging to one family.

def_cn: 住在一幢房子里的人;一家人
def_en: You can refer to all the people who live together in a house as the house .

def_cn: （用于餐饮场所的名称）餐厅，馆，屋
def_en: House is used in the names of types of places where people go to eat and drink.

def_cn: （尤用于出版、借贷或服装设计等公司的名称）公司，商行
def_en: House is used in the names of types of companies, especially ones which publish books, lend money, or design clothes.

def_cn: （用于办公楼、私宅或豪宅名称）大楼，大厦，大宅
def_en: House is sometimes used in the names of office buildings and large private homes or expensive houses.

def_cn: （英国）上（或下）议院；（美国）众议院
def_en: You can refer to the two main bodies of Britain's parliament and the United States of America's legislature as the House or a House.

def_cn: 全体辩论者;所有辩手
def_en: You can refer to all the people at a debate as the house .

def_cn: （英国学校中为进行体育竞赛等所划分的）组，社
def_en: In a British school, a house is a group of children of different ages who compete against other groups in sports and other activities. Each house usually has a name.

def_cn: 贵族;名门望族；（尤指）王室，王族
def_en: A house is a family which has been or will be important for many generations, especially the family of a king or queen.

def_cn: （剧场、影院或其他娱乐场所的）观众席;全体观众
def_en: The house is the part of a theatre, cinema, or other place of entertainment where the audience sits. You can also refer to the audience at a particular performance as the house.

def_cn: （餐馆里的葡萄酒）廉价佐餐的，未列入酒水单的
def_en: A restaurant's house wine is the cheapest wine it sells, which is not listed by name on the wine list.

def_cn: 为…提供房屋（或住所）
def_en: To house someone means to provide a house or flat for them to live in.

def_cn: 安置;容纳;作为…之用
def_en: A building or container that houses something is the place where it is located or from where it operates.

def_cn: （建筑物）供…居住，供…下榻
def_en: If you say that a building houses a number of people, you mean that is the place where they live or where they are staying.
boarding house; chapter house; clearing house; council house; doll's house; full house; open house; opera house; public house; Wendy house; White House;

def_cn: (人、表演或演讲）博得全场喝彩，引得哄堂大笑
def_en: If a person or their performance or speech brings the house down, the audience claps, laughs, or shouts loudly because the performance or speech is very impressive or amusing.

def_cn: 很快就打得火热;一见如故;一拍即合
def_en: If two people get on like a house on fire, they quickly become close friends, for example because they have many interests in common.

def_cn: （不出去工作而）操持家务，当家
def_en: If you keep house, you do the cleaning and cooking for your household, and do not go out to work.

def_cn: （餐馆或酒吧）免费招待的
def_en: If you are given something in a restaurant or bar on the house, you do not have to pay for it.

def_cn: 管好自己的事;处理好自身问题
def_en: If someone gets their house in order ,puts their house in order, or sets their house in order, they arrange their affairs and solve their problems.
